result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas Andrew Wenke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Review hearing scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.

miscConds.notes: - Pay fine in the amount of $500.00 plus ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- No possession of firearms.
- No contact with the victim JRC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas Andrew Wenke

records.addlTxt: Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights
Per clerical error, printed in error.

Defendant Lucas Andrew Wenke in court.  Attorney Vincent Hauser in court for Lucas Andrew Wenke.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNTS 2 and 3: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
 
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, Victim JRC and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
- No violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
- No possession of firearms.
- Maintain full employment
- Complete an Anger Management Course
- No contact with the victim JRC.

- Pay fine in the amount of $500.00 plus ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN
Review hearing scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 29th, 2022.

Defendant Lucas Andrew Wenke in court.  Attorney Vincent Hauser in court for Lucas Andrew Wenke.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense counsel has discovery and offer from the State and needs time to discuss with client.
Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JRC.

Defendant Lucas Andrew Wenke in court with attorney Vincent Hauser.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/11/2022@1pm
